greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 3^A001221(n) = 3^omega(n).
comment: Old name was: a(n) = sum(d|n, tau(d)*mu(d)^2 ).

The inverse Mobius transform of A074823, as the Dirichlet g.f. is product_{primes p} (1+2*p^(-s)) and the Dirichlet g.f. of A074816 is product_{primes p} (1+2*p^(-s))/(1-p^(-s)). - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 09 2011
If n is squarefree, then a(n) = #{(x, y) : x, y positive integers, lcm (x, y) = n}. See Crandall & Pomerance. - _Michel Marcus_, Mar 23 2016
reference: R. Crandall and C. Pomerance, Prime Numbers: A Computational Perspective, Springer, NY, 2001; see Exercise 2.3 p. 108.
link: R. Zumkeller, Table = of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = 3^m if n is divisible by m distinct primes. i.e. a(n)=3 if n is in A000961; a(n)=9 if n is in A007774 ...
a(n) = 3^A001221(n) = 3^omega(n). Multiplicative with a(p^e)=3. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 09 2002.
a(n) = tau_3(rad(n)) = A007425(A007947(n)). - _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Jun 24 2010
a(n) = abs(sum(d|n, A000005(d^3)*mu(d))). - _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Jun 28 2010
a(n) = Sum_{d|n, gcd(d, n/d) = 1} 2^omega(d). - _Amiram Eldar_, May 29 2020
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Sep 08 2002
ext: Simpler definition at the suggestion of _Michel Marcus_. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 25 2016
